result.execSummary:
The defendant Waylon J Hochstetler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Waylon J Hochstetler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Waylon J Hochstetler was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must sign up for Probation by tomorrow, May 28, 2015.

05/09/2016 AMENDED: COURT EXTENDS PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR FROM 5/27/16 TO 5/27/17.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
